pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:0.4: The sub-chapter on sunshades and sandals
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:0.5: 88. The training rule on scents and colors
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.2: the nuns from the group of six were bathing with scents and colors.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.4: “How can nuns bathe with scents and colors? They are just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.5: The nuns heard the complaints of those people.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.6: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.7: “How can the nuns from the group of six bathe with scents and colors?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.8: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.11: “… How can the nuns from the group of six do this?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.12: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.13: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:1.14.1: ‘If a nun bathes with scents and colors, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:2.1.10: is bathing. For the effort there is an act of wrong conduct. At the end of the bath, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:2.2.2: if she does it because she is ill;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:2.2.4: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc88:2.2.5: The fifth training rule is finished.
